benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId} - Transfer a bundle to another account

covered: Valid payloads: success flows for minimum required fields and for all optional parameters (requestedDate, billingPolicy, pluginProperty) with 201, response Bundle body and Location header (TC01, TC02, TC26).
Billing policy variants: explicit coverage of START_OF_TERM, END_OF_TERM and IMMEDIATE and default behavior (TC03, TC26).

Input validation and error handling: invalid bundleId format, invalid requestedDate, invalid billingPolicy, missing request body (accountId), missing required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header — mapped to 400 responses (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12).
Not-found cases and DB state variations: bundle not found, target account not found, empty DB and partially populated DB returning 404 (TC06, TC07, TC22, TC23).
Authentication and basic error codes: unauthorized (401) and service/unexpected errors (503, 500) are exercised (TC13, TC14, TC24).
Security/input-sanitization: SQL injection and XSS attempts in inputs are tested (TC15, TC16).
Edge cases and extras: empty pluginProperty array, multiple pluginProperty entries, extra unexpected params ignored, transfer-to-same-account regression covered (TC05, TC18, TC19, TC25).
Large payload boundary: pluginProperty large payload and handling of payload-too-large (201 or 413) (TC20).
Header constraints: required X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence and tests for max length on reason/comment headers (TC01, TC02, TC21).
Performance & concurrency: response time under normal/peak load, concurrent requests, resource utilization and recovery from transient network failure (TC17, TC27–TC30).
Response content: checks that the response body is a Bundle JSON representing the transferred bundle and Location header is present (TC01, TC02).
Accessibility & documentation expectations: API docs and machine-readable error codes covered as a high-level requirement (TC31).
gaps: Duplicate submission / idempotency: no explicit test for repeated identical POSTs to verify deduplication or idempotent behavior (e.g., same body posted twice, or behavior when an Idempotency-Key is provided).
Malformed JSON and Content-Type validation: missing/incorrect Content-Type header or syntactically invalid JSON payload cases (415/400) are not covered.
accountId format validation: no explicit test for an invalid non-UUID accountId format in the request body (400).

Type and schema validation for request body fields: cases where pluginProperty is wrong type (not array), accountId wrong type, or other schema violations are not explicitly tested beyond XSS/SQL injection.

Concurrency on the same resource: race conditions when two requests attempt to transfer the same bundle simultaneously (assert single successful transfer or proper locking) are not covered — TC29 uses different bundleIds.
requestedDate edge cases: past/future/out-of-range dates, timezone effects, or requestedDate before subscription start/end are not covered (only "today" case exists).
Response header assertions: Content-Type (application/json), strict Location URL format, and that POST responses are not cached (Cache-Control) are not explicitly asserted.
Authorization granularity: tests for authenticated-but-forbidden (403) scenarios (insufficient privileges) are missing — only unauthenticated 401 is covered.
Rate limiting / throttling: no tests for 429 responses or server throttling under bursts beyond performance/concurrency tests.
Malformed query-param combinations: e.g., multiple billingPolicy query entries, pluginProperty encoding edge cases, unexpected types in query params are not explicitly tested.
recommendations: Add duplicate-submission/idempotency tests: post the same transfer twice (with and without an Idempotency-Key) and assert the system either de-duplicates or returns a predictable error/identical response without creating duplicate state.
Add malformed JSON and Content-Type tests: send requests with no Content-Type, wrong Content-Type, and invalid JSON body; assert correct 400/415 behaviour and clear error messages.
Add accountId format validation tests: supply non-UUID accountId values in the body to confirm 400 validation errors are returned.
Add strict schema/type tests: send pluginProperty as wrong types (string, object), or accountId as numeric, to verify schema validation and clear error responses.

Add concurrency tests on the same bundle: two simultaneous transfers of the same bundle to different accounts to validate locking, single-success semantics, or sensible conflict errors and no data corruption.
Expand requestedDate tests: include past dates, far-future dates, dates before subscription start/end and timezone boundary cases to confirm acceptance/rejection and correct effective date handling.
Assert response headers: verify Content-Type is application/json, Location header exact format/URL pattern, and that responses to POST are not cached (Cache-Control/Pragma headers).
Add authorization-permission tests: authenticated but unauthorized user should receive 403 when attempting transfers they are not permitted to perform.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: bomb the endpoint to confirm 429 or other throttling behavior and graceful degradation under burst traffic.
Add negative query-param combination tests: multiple billingPolicy entries, malformed pluginProperty encoding, and other invalid query permutations to ensure robust validation.
